reviewText:
Overload. Absolute, terrifying overload. I like watching lower-budget kids movies, but this one lives in a valley that I don't want to visit. From the beginning to the end, I was assaulted with images, asides from characters that were never explained, and I didn't sympathize with the three bots. Possibly because they are each, in their own unique way, hard to understand. One of them varies its pitch as it talks, auto tuning up and down a wandering scale as it's uneven computer monitor eyes bobble but never fall.

The songs come too quickly on top of one another, and they go on for a long time with repetitive choruses. It is too much. My cats were scared of it.
